candidates.title: Release v0.7
candidates.body:
It's ready.

The major focus of this release is "view widgets": the ability to construct a
synchronised view over shared data.

The new view widgets allow completion of the "CRUD" (Create, Read, Update,
Delete) [7GUIs challenge app](https://github.com/kas-gui/7guis/). The use of
view widgets allows data-UI separation and scaling to larger data sets (mainly
limited by the `O(n)` filter in this example). Work also started on the Cells
challenge (mini-spreadsheet), though many details of the app and of the
`MatrixView` widget still need addressing, especially drawing, multi-cell
selection and keyboard handling.

Additionally, this version saw development of a new mini-library, `kas::conv`,
which spun off into its own lib [easy-cast](https://crates.io/crates/easy-cast).

[Read the full CHANGELOG here.](https://github.com/kas-gui/kas/blob/441d1e061a4031314e5df63887f51038b5544135/CHANGELOG.md#070--2021-04-03)

Note: for now, KAS requires the beta compiler (1.52.0, scheduled for release in early May).

See also the [KAS tutorial series](https://kas-gui.github.io/tutorials/).

candidates.title: Switch to easy-cast; CHANGELOG for 0.7.0; with_reserve, with_label, cleanup
Fix view selection from child; use window_clipboard; update deps
Recursive data updates; reorganise core widget traits
candidates.body:
Shared data traits got significantly revised to better handle updates, especially for derived types (filters). This allows correct updating in the 7-GUIs CRUD example.

Data trait hierarchy is not ideal but I haven't found a better solution:

- `SharedData`
- `SharedDataRec: SharedData` (extension which may only be implementable in some cases, such as on `Rc<T>`)
- `ListData: SharedDataRec` (this could depend on just `SharedData` or be independent, but then we'd need multi-trait objects (https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/issues/2035) for dyn objects)
- `ListDataMut: ListData` (an obvious extension)

We could instead have `ListDataRec: ListData + SharedData`, but then we'd also need `SingleDataRec`.

Reorganised:

- Core widget traits have been moved into `kas::core` (internal)
- `Future` moved into `kas::future` (internal)
- `ThemeAction` and `ThemeApi` are moved into `kas::draw` (affects API)
- Shared data traits moved into `kas::data` (affects API)

candidates.title: View widgets: reorg, more widgets, data write, dynamic-view example
candidates.body:
This is a big PR:

- view widget modules were reorganised
- new `View` trait replaces `ViewWidget`, allowing custom construction/get/set and data payload
- all applicable standard "data" widgets are usable with the `View` trait
- data traits get new `update` method; `set` takes `&mut self`; internal `RefCell` sometimes required
- new `dynamic-view` example (variant of `dynamic` with `O(1)` performance w.r.t. number of data entries)
- `ScrollWidget` trait renamed to `Scrollable`
- Add `Response::Update` to indicate a data update with no message
- Remove data payload from `Response::Unhandled`

candidates.title: Update dependencies
candidates.body:
To fix:

- [x] invalid scissor rect validation error

candidates.title: Config read/write support
candidates.body:
Adds working read & write support for shortcut configuration.

JSON and YAML support are included. TOML is not because the `toml` crate does not support enums as map keys and I don't see another TOML+Serde crate.

Adjusts `kas_wgpu::Options`, adding two env vars controlling behaviour.

Some cleanup is needed before merge, but otherwise I think this is good for now. The file format is unstable and until that changes, there won't be a default config path, though later there should be (using the `directories` crate or similar).

~~TODO: cleanup commits, better documentation?~~

Edit: done cleanup; serde is now optional.

candidates.title: Shortcuts: extend, add specific MacOS shortcuts; rename ControlKey → Command
candidates.body:
MacOS and Windows should now have most of the right shortcuts for text-editing, plus a bunch more (currently unused). There's currently no differentiation between Linux (KDE, Gnome, ...) and Windows and no direct consideration for anything else — probably testing and feedback is needed.

Run-time and application-specific configuration is obviously needed and being planned.

Some system for handling global shortcuts is also required — e.g. whether `Exit` (Ctrl+Q on most platforms) closes the app immediately or prompts or does nothing (current behaviour).

This PR also moves direction and alignment types to tidy up the top-level API.

Edit: also added `Cast` and `CastFloat` traits.

candidates.title: Work2
candidates.body:
Reduce the number of resize actions.

Fix rounding with `f32 → u32` conversion on text size requirements.

Fix a bug where *not* reducing the allocated widget number in ViewList caused an issue when frame-swapping? (At any rate, we no longer crash on frame-swap errors and I no longer see any frame-swap errors.)

ViewList is now a nav fallback candidate. Calling `set_accel_string` now triggers a reconfigure if the keys change.

All grab handles now use the "grab" cursor icon (I don't see this icon widely used in other apps, but it certainly helps with positioning when using the splitter and scrollbars).

candidates.title: ScrollBars wrapper, filter-list with large numbers of entries
candidates.body:
Tested with 31567568 entries (much more than that and the `u32` type used for pixel sizes becomes a problem).

Also fix (or work around) https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/78113

chosen_pr.title: Release v0.7
chosen_pr.body:
It's ready.

The major focus of this release is "view widgets": the ability to construct a
synchronised view over shared data.

The new view widgets allow completion of the "CRUD" (Create, Read, Update,
Delete) [7GUIs challenge app](https://github.com/kas-gui/7guis/). The use of
view widgets allows data-UI separation and scaling to larger data sets (mainly
limited by the `O(n)` filter in this example). Work also started on the Cells
challenge (mini-spreadsheet), though many details of the app and of the
`MatrixView` widget still need addressing, especially drawing, multi-cell
selection and keyboard handling.

Additionally, this version saw development of a new mini-library, `kas::conv`,
which spun off into its own lib [easy-cast](https://crates.io/crates/easy-cast).

[Read the full CHANGELOG here.](https://github.com/kas-gui/kas/blob/441d1e061a4031314e5df63887f51038b5544135/CHANGELOG.md#070--2021-04-03)

Note: for now, KAS requires the beta compiler (1.52.0, scheduled for release in early May).

See also the [KAS tutorial series](https://kas-gui.github.io/tutorials/).
